intro: Bosqueia danguyana, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemose inflorescences. Its fruit is a spherical, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, often used in culinary applications. Bosqueia danguyana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
